en:
On Sunday 16th October,2022, for our last performance in Rumphi we went to the village of Bowe, where we received a warm welcome from local villagers. 
The teachers in each local village were essential in helping us ask the audiences questions about the activities, which will be important for our research. There was a great football match between Bowe vs Betere and the local netball teams played really well too.
This, being our last performance in Rumphi, was very successful and we had lots of good questions about African Trypanosomiasis from the crowd.
ny: Lamlungu pa 16 October, 2022, poimba komaliza ku Rumphi tinapita kumudzi wa Bowe, komwe tinalandiridwa bwino ndi anthu akumudzi kwathu. Aphunzitsi a m’mudzi uliwonse wa m’derali anali ofunikira potithandiza kufunsa anthu mafunso okhudza ntchito, zomwe zingakhale zofunika pa kafukufuku wathu. Panali masewera opambana a mpira pakati pa Bowe vs Betere ndipo matimu ampira ampira amderali adaseweranso bwino kwambiri. Uwu, pokhala sewero lathu lomaliza ku Rumphi, udachita bwino kwambiri ndipo tinali ndi mafunso ambiri abwino okhudza African Trypanosomiasis kuchokera pagulu.

ny: ZIMENE BAIBULO LIMANENA PA ZA TSOGOLO LA UTSOGOLERI WA MALAWI

en: Introduction
ny: Mawu Oyamba

en: Fellow Malawians, it is with great conviction and patriotism for my country, that I have decided to speak on issues that are affecting us all. I say conviction and patriotism for my country because in taking this stand, I am well aware of the associated risks to me personally, my family and my colleagues. However, my personal comfort plays subordinate to the national good. It is on that basis that I have braved to make this statement.
ny: Amalawi anzanga, ndikukhudzika ndi kukonda kwambiri dziko langa, ndaganiza zoyankhula pa nkhani zomwe zikutikhudza tonse. Ndikunena kukhudzika ndi kukonda dziko langa chifukwa potengera izi, ndikudziwa bwino za zoopsa zomwe zingabwere kwa ine, banja langa komanso anzanga. Komabe, chitonthozo changa chaumwini chimakhala pansi pa zabwino zadziko. Pachifukwa chimenecho ndalimbika mtima kunena mawu awa.

en: I am inspired by the many brave Malawians who have come before me. From the time of Reverend John Chilembwe to Dr. Kamuzu Banda, who fought against a white establishment for us to attain political independence. I am inspired by the likes of Dr. Bakili Muluzi, late Chakufwa Chihana, late Aleke Banda and all those who braved the one-party system in the early 1990s for us to have democracy. These Malawians knew the risks so well but put the interest of the nation far ahead of their personal interests. If it were not for their sacrifices, perhaps we would until today be under colonial rule or under one-party system. This statement I am making is a fruit of their sacrifices. I am personally indebted to them all.
ny: Ndidalimbikitsidwa ndi Amalawi ambiri olimba mtima omwe adabwera ndisanabadwe. Kuyambira nthawi ya Reverend John Chilembwe mpaka Dr. Kamuzu Banda, omwe analimbana ndi azungu kuti tipeze ufulu wodzilamulira pa ndale. Ndalimbikitsidwa ndi Dr. Bakili Muluzi, malemu Chakufwa Chihana, malemu Aleke Banda ndi onse omwe adalimba mtima ndi chipani chimodzi kuchiyambi kwa zaka za m'ma 1990 kuti tikhale ndi demokalase. Amalawiwa ankadziwa zoopsazi koma ankaika zofuna za dziko patsogolo pa zofuna zawo. Pakadapanda kudzipereka kwawo, mwina mpaka lero tikanakhala pansi pa ulamuliro wachitsamunda kapena chipani chimodzi. Mawu awa amene ndikunena ndi chipatso cha nsembe zawo. Ine ndekha ndili ndi mangawa kwa iwo onse.

en: Malawi is a country well-endowed with natural resources and a predominantly youthful and energetic human resource which unfortunately is currently under- utilized. Malawi has everything required for her people to economically develop except it lacks effective leadership. Our development challenges have remained the same. Economic growth rate remains low, children still learn under a tree, health facilities are poorly resourced, some people have yet to have access to safe drinking water, agriculture is largely rain-fed and subsistence, markets for agricultural produce are weak and unpredictable, few people own houses in urban areas and only few houses in rural areas are permanent, transport system is inefficient and expensive, university students from low income households continue to face the risk of withdrawal on account of lack of tuition fee or upkeep expenses, small and medium enterprises cannot grow because the business environment is less conducive and some districts have yet to have tarmac road until now.
ny: Dziko la Malawi ndi dziko lomwe lili ndi zinthu zachilengedwe komanso lili ndi anthu ambiri achinyamata komanso achangu, zomwe mwatsoka sizikugwiritsidwa ntchito mokwanira. Dziko la Malawi lili ndi zonse zofunika kuti anthu ake atukuke pachuma kupatula kuti alibe utsogoleri wabwino. Zovuta zathu zachitukuko zakhalabe zomwezo. Kukula kwachuma kumakhalabe kotsika, ana amaphunzirabe pansi pa mtengo, zipatala zilibe zida zokwanira, anthu ena sakupezabe madzi abwino akumwa, ulimi nthawi zambiri umakhala wa mvula komanso wokhazikika, misika yazaulimi ndi yofooka komanso yosadziwika bwino, ochepa. anthu ali ndi nyumba m'matauni ndipo ndi nyumba zochepa chabe kumidzi zomwe zimakhala zachikhalire, kayendedwe ka kayendedwe kake kamakhala kosagwira ntchito komanso kokwera mtengo, ophunzira aku yunivesite ochokera m'mabanja omwe amapeza ndalama zochepa akupitiriza kukumana ndi chiopsezo chosiya ntchito chifukwa chosowa malipiro a maphunziro kapena ndalama zothandizira, zazing'ono ndi zapakati. mabizinesi sangathe kukula chifukwa malo abizinesi ndi ochepa komanso maboma ena sadakhale ndi misewu ya phula mpaka pano.

en: In fact, if one reads the priorities in the 1965 Nyasaland Development Plan and compare with priorities in the Statement of Development Policies in 1970s to mid- 1990s, then read Vision 2020 and then read Malawi 2063, it is clear that our priorities have remained the same. The reason they have remained the same is because they remain challenges because we have not made noticeable improvement as a country. The reason they remain challenges is because no leadership has addressed any key priority exhaustively. We still discuss food insecurity. We still discuss poor access to safe drinking water. We still discuss lack of all-weather roads in some areas. We still discuss poor access to electricity. We still discuss lack of profitable markets for farmers. We still discuss high unemployment especially among the youth.
ny: Ngati munthu awerenga zomwe zili mu 1965 Nyasaland Development Plan ndikufanizira ndi zomwe zili mu Statement of Development Policies mzaka za m'ma 1970 mpaka pakati pa 1990, ndiye kuwerenga Masomphenya a 2020 ndikuwerenga Malawi 2063, zikuwonekeratu kuti zomwe tidaziika patsogolo zakhalabe. yemweyo. Chifukwa chomwe akhalabe omwewo ndi chifukwa amakhalabe ndi zovuta chifukwa sitinachite bwino ngati dziko. Chifukwa chomwe amakhalirabe zovuta ndi chifukwa palibe utsogoleri womwe wakwaniritsa zofunikira zonse. Tikukambilanabe za kusowa kwa chakudya. Timakambilanabe za kusapeza bwino madzi akumwa abwino. Timakambiranabe za kusowa kwa misewu ya nyengo yonse m'madera ena. Tikukambilanabe za kusapezeka kwa magetsi. Timakambilanabe za kusowa kwa misika yopindulitsa kwa alimi. Tikukambilanabe za ulova wochuluka makamaka pakati pa achinyamata.

en: Economy
ny: Chuma

en: Fellow Malawians, our economy remains small, vulnerable to shocks and we continue carrying the Least Developed Country label. Even more irritating is that countries which have been at war or in conflict have economies stronger than ours. The weak economy we have is not the make of nature. It is the make of our leaders. While acknowledging periods of progress, such periods have been episodic and short-lived.
ny: Amalawi anzanga, chuma chathu chikadali chaching'ono, sitingathe kudodometsa ndipo tikupitilizabe kukhala ndi chizindikiro cha Dziko Losatukuka. Chokhumudwitsa kwambiri n'chakuti mayiko omwe akhala akumenyana kapena kumenyana ali ndi chuma champhamvu kuposa chathu. Chuma chofooka chomwe tili nacho sichinthu chachilengedwe. Ndi mapangidwe a atsogoleri athu. Ngakhale kuvomereza nthawi za kupita patsogolo, nthawi zoterezi zakhala zachidule komanso zaufupi.

en: Malawi has capacity to feed itself and other countries given its abundant water resources for irrigation. Malawi has capacity to substitute imports and to increase exports and in so doing improve her balance of payments, stabilize exchange rate and contain inflation rate. Malawi has capacity to manage its own budget without heavy borrowing.
ny: Dziko la Malawi lili ndi mphamvu yodzipezera chakudya komanso maiko ena chifukwa lili ndi madzi ochuluka othirira. Dziko la Malawi lili ndi mphamvu zolowa m'malo mwa katundu wogula kuchokera kunja ndi kuonjezera katundu wogulitsira kunja ndipo potero akweza malipiro ake, kukhazika mtima pansi komanso kusunga mitengo ya inflation. Dziko la Malawi lili ndi mphamvu zoyendetsera bajeti yake popanda kubwereka ndalama zambiri.

en: Sadly, people we have put in position of power to advance our common interests have opted to pursue personal interests, maintain luxuries and perpetuate the status quo at the expense of common Malawians whom they are meant to serve. There is both outright impunity and institutionalized impunity. An example of institutionalized impunity is the heaping of allowance entitlements to cabinet members and senior government officers when middle and junior level officers continue earning low salaries.
ny: Chomvetsa chisoni n’chakuti anthu amene tawaika m’maudindo kuti apititse patsogolo zofuna zathu zonse asankha kuchita zofuna zawo, kukhala ndi moyo wapamwamba komanso kupititsa patsogolo zinthu zomwe zili m’gululi movutitsa Amalawi wamba amene amayenera kuwatumikira. Pali zonse ziŵiri kusalangidwa kotheratu ndi kusalanga anthu m’zipembedzo. Chitsanzo cha kusalanga anthu m'mabungwe ndi kuchuluka kwa ndalama zoperekedwa kwa nduna ndi akuluakulu aboma pomwe maofesala apakati ndi aang'ono akupitilira kulandira malipiro ochepa.

en: We have a system which just fuel allowance entitlement of a cabinet member is worth more than a salary of a Principal Secretary and fuel allowance entitlement of a Principal Secretary is worth more than a salary of a middle level officer. The same is the case in state owned enterprises.
ny: Tili ndi dongosolo lomwe kuyenera kwa nduna ya nduna ya mafuta kumapereka ndalama zambiri kuposa malipiro a Mlembi Wamkulu ndipo ufulu wa mafuta a Mlembi Wamkulu ndi woposa malipiro a mkulu wapakati. Momwemonso ndi momwe zimakhalira m'mabizinesi aboma.

en: I stand with you; teachers, police officers, healthcare workers, agriculture extension workers and many others whose salary is a fraction of just one allowance entitlement of a senior public officer and a minister. Surely, this is institutionalized impunity and must stop.
ny: Ine ndikuyima ndi inu; aphunzitsi, apolisi, ogwira ntchito zachipatala, ogwira ntchito zaulimi ndi ena ambiri omwe malipiro awo ndi kachigawo kakang'ono ka malipiro a munthu wamkulu wa boma ndi nduna. Zowonadi, uku ndikupanda chilango kokhazikika ndipo kuyenera kuyimitsa.

en: I stand with you parents whose children are learning under a tree. I stand with you families who are struggling to put food on the table. I stand with you families whose sick relatives are sent back from hospital without receiving treatment. I stand with you, university students, who are struggling to meet upkeep expenses. I stand with you who are looking for a job which you are not able to find. I stand with you farmers who have been at subsistence level without hope of growing to a higher level. Your next government will stand with you. It will be a government whose job is to offer solutions and will address the challenges you are facing. You can count on me.
ny: Ndikuyima nanu makolo amene ana anu akuphunzira pansi pa mtengo. Ndikuyima ndi inu mabanja omwe mukuvutikira kuyika chakudya patebulo. Ndikuyima nanu mabanja amene achibale awo odwala abwezedwa kuchipatala osalandira chithandizo. Ndikuyimirira nanu, ophunzira akuyunivesite, omwe mukuvutikira kupeza ndalama zolipirira. Ndikuyima ndi inu amene mukufunafuna ntchito yomwe simuipeza. Ndikuyima nanu alimi omwe mwakhala mukungodzisamalira opanda chiyembekezo chodzakwera pamwamba. Boma lanu lotsatira lidzayima ndi inu. Lidzakhala boma lomwe ntchito yake ndi kupereka njira zothetsera mavuto omwe mukukumana nawo. Mutha kudalira ine.

en: Fellow Malawians, I believe in the potential of our country and in Malawians. We read positive stories about economic success of Rwanda. Zambia has just changed narrative since their current government came in office later than our current government and we are hearing positive stories. There is no reason other than poor leadership, that stories for Malawi that make international news headlines are poverty, hunger and corruption involving high profile public officers.
ny: Amalawi anzanga, ndikhulupilira kukhoza kwa dziko lathu komanso Amalawi. Tidawerenga nkhani zabwino zokhudzana ndi chuma cha Rwanda. Zambia yangosintha nkhani kuyambira pomwe boma lawo lidabwera mochedwa kuposa boma lathu lomwe lilipo ndipo tikumva nkhani zabwino. Palibenso chifukwa china koma utsogoleri wosauka, kuti nkhani za Malawi zomwe zimakonda nkhani zapadziko lonse lapansi ndi umphawi, njala ndi katangale zomwe zimakhudza akuluakulu aboma.

en: I feel the pain we are all going through in the tough economic times. I acknowledge that part of the reasons for the economic challenges are external factors such as a war in Ukraine and tropical cyclones. However, as I have said time and again in various media interviews, the external factors have just contributed. A large part of the challenges is our own making. The past national budgets by the current political administration were poorly prepared, not transformative and did not build foundation for macroeconomic stability. I said it in 2020 and have consistently said this. The problems we are going through were anticipated and I did not keep quiet, I shared my views then.
ny: Ndikumva ululu womwe tonse tikukumana nawo m'nthawi yovuta yazachuma. Ndikuvomereza kuti zina mwa zifukwa za mavuto azachuma ndi zinthu zakunja monga nkhondo ya ku Ukraine ndi mvula yamkuntho. Komabe, monga ndanenera mobwerezabwereza m'mafunso osiyanasiyana atolankhani, zinthu zakunja zangothandizira. Mbali yaikulu ya mavuto ndi kupanga kwathu tokha. Mabajeti am'mbuyomu a dziko laulamuliro wandale wapano anali osakonzekera bwino, osasintha ndipo sanapange maziko a kukhazikika kwachuma chachikulu. Ndidanena mu 2020 ndipo ndanena izi mosasintha. Mavuto omwe tikukumana nawo anali oyembekezeredwa ndipo sindinakhale chete, ndidagawana malingaliro anga pamenepo.

en: The fast-rising public debt is testimony of lack of fiscal discipline. We were reminded a month ago that every Malawian is carrying on our shoulders a debt burden of K600,000. Unfortunately, this is not debt that financed programs to improve the living standard of us all. This is debt that financed corruption and luxury of senior officers. There has been limited interest to reform the fiscal plan – to remove or reduce unnecessary expenditure items and to grow the revenue base by increasing resource allocation to productive sectors. Additionally, there has been high level inefficiency in government resulting in delays to approve projects. The State President himself and some ministers have admitted this in public. Delay to approve projects locks up foreign exchange since most projects are donor- funded, delays job opportunities and delays development outcomes. These are the main reasons we are going through difficult times. If the leadership was up to task, the extent of suffering would be less than is the case.
ny: Ngongole zaboma zomwe zikuchulukirachulukira ndi umboni wa kusowa kwa kayendetsedwe kazachuma. Tidakumbutsidwa mwezi wapitawo kuti Amalawi aliyense ali ndi ngongole yokwana K600,000 paphewa. Tsoka ilo, iyi si ngongole yomwe idapereka ndalama zothandizira kuti tonsefe tikhale ndi moyo wabwino. Iyi ndi ngongole yomwe inkathandizira katangale komanso kutukuka kwa akuluakulu. Pakhala pali chidwi chochepa chofuna kusintha ndondomeko ya zachuma - kuchotsa kapena kuchepetsa zinthu zosafunikira komanso kukulitsa ndalama zopezera ndalama powonjezera kugawidwa kwazinthu kumagulu opindulitsa. Kuonjezera apo, pakhala kusagwira bwino ntchito kwa boma zomwe zachititsa kuti achedwe kuvomereza ntchito. Mtsogoleri wa dziko komanso nduna zina avomereza izi pamaso pa anthu. Kuchedwa kuvomereza ntchito kumatsekereza ndalama zakunja chifukwa mapulojekiti ambiri amathandizidwa ndi ndalama, kuchedwetsa mwayi wantchito komanso kuchedwetsa chitukuko. Izi ndi zifukwa zazikulu zomwe tikukumana ndi zovuta. Utsogoleri ukadakhala kuti ukugwira ntchito, kuvutikako kukanakhala kochepa kuposa momwe zilili.

en: My colleagues and I come to offer genuine transformation. Malawi is a natural resource-rich and labour-abundant economy. Our economic policy will revolve around maximizing the potential in agriculture, mining, tourism and developing the human resource both in its own right and as catalysts for manufacturing. This will be done while progressively moving towards a knowledge economy by investing in science and technology.
ny: Ine ndi anzanga timabwera kudzapereka kusintha kwenikweni. Dziko la Malawi lili ndi chuma chambiri komanso chochuluka kwa antchito. Ndondomeko yathu yazachuma ikhudza kukulitsa luso lazaulimi, migodi, zokopa alendo komanso kukulitsa luso la anthu pazokha komanso ngati zolimbikitsa kupanga. Izi zidzachitika pamene tikupita patsogolo ku chuma cha chidziwitso poika ndalama mu sayansi ndi luso lamakono.

en: I will implement Malawi 2063 in its entirety. I am happy to inform you, fellow Malawians, that Malawi 2063 is a document I intimately subscribe to, because I was one of the reviewers. I also co-reviewed the enabler on enhanced public sector performance in the Malawi 2063 first 10 years Implementation Plan. My being identified as a person who could review this enabler is testimony that I understand the public service and I know how to make it perform. When I say I will implement it fully, I know what is in the document and I have adequate passion to implement it. I emphasize I because the responsibility for implementing a strategic plan in any organization is vested in the head of the organization. What makes a strategy work for one organization and fail for the other organization, is the quality of leadership of the organization. I will provide quality leadership.
ny: Ndikhazikitsa Malawi 2063 yonse. Ndine wokondwa kukudziwitsani a Malawi anzanga kuti Malawi 2063 ndi chikalata chomwe ndimalembetsa nacho mwachidwi chifukwa ndinali m'modzi mwa omwe adawunika. Ndinaunikanso mothandizana nawo pa kulimbikitsa ntchito za mabungwe a boma mu Ndondomeko Yokwaniritsira zaka 10 ya Malawi 2063. Kuzindikiridwa kwanga ngati munthu yemwe ndingathe kuwunikiranso izi ndi umboni wakuti ndimamvetsetsa ntchito za boma ndipo ndikudziwa momwe ndingachitire. Ndikanena kuti ndikwaniritsa zonse, ndikudziwa zomwe zili mu chikalatacho ndipo ndili ndi chidwi chokwaniritsa. Ndikutsindika ine chifukwa udindo wokhazikitsa ndondomeko mu bungwe lililonse uli ndi mutu wa bungwe. Chomwe chimapangitsa kuti ndondomeko igwire ntchito ku bungwe limodzi ndikulephera kwa bungwe lina, ndi khalidwe la utsogoleri wa bungwe. Ndipereka utsogoleri wabwino.

en: We will transform agriculture through Mega farms and cooperatives which will facilitate mechanization, improve productivity, promote access to reliable markets for farmers, catalyze industrialization and urbanization. We will embark on infrastructure revolution agenda. From electricity generation, transport and ICT to residential and government office buildings.
ny: Tidzasintha ulimi kudzera m'mafamu a Mega ndi ma cooperative omwe athandizira kugwiritsa ntchito makina, kukonza zokolola, kulimbikitsa mwayi wopeza misika yodalirika kwa alimi, kulimbikitsa kukula kwa mafakitale ndi kukwera kwa mizinda. Tidzayamba ndi ndondomeko yosintha chitukuko. Kuyambira kupanga magetsi, zoyendera ndi ICT kupita ku nyumba zogona komanso maofesi aboma.

en: We will decisively support micro, small and medium enterprises. We will identify those which Malawi has comparative and competitive advantage to produce and have niche markets in the region and prioritize support to them. One key performance indicator for the Ministry of Industrialization and Trade will be the number of micro-scale enterprises graduating into small-scale; the number of small-scale enterprises graduating into medium-scale; the number of medium-scale graduating into large-scale annually. We will encourage and support Malawian large-scale enterprises to become multinational corporations. We denounce the glorification of the MSME concept as if that is the ideal destiny for them. They will be helped to grow.
ny: Tidzathandizira mabizinesi ang'onoang'ono, ang'onoang'ono ndi apakatikati. Tidzazindikira omwe dziko la Malawi lili ndi mwayi wofananiza komanso wopikisana kuti lipange ndikukhala ndi misika yayikulu mderali ndikuyika chithandizo patsogolo kwa iwo. Chizindikiro chimodzi chofunika kwambiri cha ntchito za Unduna wa Zamakampani ndi Malonda ndi kuchuluka kwa mabizinesi ang'onoang'ono omwe amaliza maphunziro awo ang'onoang'ono; kuchuluka kwa mabizinesi ang'onoang'ono omwe amaliza maphunziro apakati; chiwerengero cha omaliza maphunziro apakati pazaka zazikulu pachaka. Tilimbikitsa ndi kuthandizira mabizinesi akuluakulu aku Malawi kuti akhale mabungwe amitundu yosiyanasiyana. Timatsutsa kulemekezedwa kwa lingaliro la MSME ngati kuti ndilo tsogolo labwino kwa iwo. Iwo adzathandizidwa kukula.

en: There are four main ways in which a country can benefit from its extractive resources which include mining. These are i) royalties, ii) resource rent iii) State participation and iv) taxes. So far, the component of State participation has not been exploited despite being the most beneficial way. To maximize benefits from mining, government will establish a Mining Company that will be getting into Joint Venture arrangement with foreign companies. Joint Venture arrangements will enable Malawians to be in management team and in the Board of Directors, thereby directly participating in running mining business and curb transfer pricing and other forms of illicit financial flows that often happen in mining industry. Your next government will review tax incentives to ensure Malawians get a fair share of their natural resources.
ny: Pali njira zinayi zazikulu zomwe dziko lingapindule ndi chuma chake chomwe chimaphatikizapo migodi. Izi ndi i) malipiro, ii) lendi ya zinthu zogwirira ntchito iii) Kutengapo mbali kwa boma ndi iv) misonkho. Mpaka pano, gawo la kutenga nawo gawo kwa Boma silinagwiritsidwepo ntchito ngakhale kuti ndi njira yopindulitsa kwambiri. Pofuna kupeza phindu lochokera ku migodi, boma likhazikitsa Kampani ya Migodi yomwe izikhala ikuchita nawo mgwirizano ndi makampani akunja. Makonzedwe a Mgwirizano wa Mgwirizano athandiza Amalawi kukhala mu gulu loyang'anira ndi mu Komiti Yoyang'anira, potero kutenga nawo mbali poyendetsa bizinesi ya migodi ndi kuchepetsa mitengo yamtengo wapatali ndi njira zina zosavomerezeka zandalama zomwe zimachitika nthawi zambiri m'makampani amigodi. Boma lanu lotsatira lidzaunikanso zolimbikitsa zamisonkho kuti Amalawi apeze gawo loyenera la chuma chawo.

en: We will approach tourism holistically and contextually. Tourism is about attraction. We will invest in areas that are unique to Malawi, one of them is establishing vibrant cultural centers and packaging our history into a commercial product. Tourism is a beneficiary of derived demand. Our resolve to develop the economy, develop manufacturing sector will positively contribute to the travel and tourism industry. We will make Malawi a destination for citizens of neighboring countries to come and shop. As they come, they will need accommodation and transport just as Malawians do when they travel outside.
ny: Tidzayang'ana zokopa alendo mokwanira komanso mogwirizana. Tourism imakhudza kukopa. Tipanga ndalama m'madera omwe ndi a Malawi okha, imodzi mwa izo ndikukhazikitsa malo osangalatsa a chikhalidwe komanso kuyika mbiri yathu kukhala malonda. Tourism imapindula ndi zomwe zafunidwa. Kutsimikiza kwathu kukulitsa chuma, kukulitsa gawo lazopangapanga kumathandizira kwambiri pamakampani oyenda ndi zokopa alendo. Tipanga dziko la Malawi kukhala kofikira nzika za maiko oyandikana nawo kuti zibwere kudzagula zinthu. Akabwera adzafunika malo ogona komanso zoyendera ngati mmene amalawi amachitira akamatuluka kunja.

en: Agriculture transformation, infrastructure revolution, growing of MSMEs, mining, industrialization (manufacturing) and tourism will anchor our job creation agenda.
ny: Kusintha kwaulimi, kusintha kwa zomangamanga, kukula kwa ma MSME, migodi, chitukuko cha mafakitale (kupanga) ndi zokopa alendo zidzakhazikitsa ndondomeko yathu yopezera ntchito.

en: My fellow Malawians, I am aware of the key drivers of cost of living. We will overhaul the fuel procurement system in the short-term while investing in cost- effective mode of transport such as rail and pipeline in line with the Malawi National Transport Master Plan. We will review all levies and remove or reduce those that can be done so without compromising public service delivery. We will work to achieve macroeconomic stability with a stable and relatively strong currency to contain imported inflation. In line with Malawi 2063, we will enhance agricultural productivity so that price of food is cheap while farmers still make profit.
ny: Amalawi anzanga, ndikudziwa zomwe zikuyambitsa kukwera kwachuma. Tidzakonza njira zogulira mafuta pakanthawi kochepa pomwe tikuika ndalama zoyendera zotsika mtengo monga njanji ndi mapaipi mogwirizana ndi dongosolo la Malawi National Transport Master Plan. Tidzawunikanso ma msonkho onse ndikuchotsa kapena kuchepetsa zomwe zingachitike popanda kusokoneza kayendetsedwe ka anthu. Tidzagwira ntchito kuti tikwaniritse kukhazikika kwachuma chachikulu ndi ndalama yokhazikika komanso yamphamvu kuti ikhale ndi kukwera kwamitengo yochokera kunja. Mogwirizana ndi Malawi 2063, tikulitsa zokolola zaulimi kuti mtengo wa chakudya ukhale wotchipa pomwe alimi amapezabe phindu.

en: We will embark on an ambitious home ownership program in which Malawi Housing Corporation will be recapitalized so it can build houses of different designs to suit your affordability. You will be paying monthly rental fee but which will be going towards purchase of the house. We will make home ownership easy for everyone. A well-thought housing scheme will be implemented in rural areas.
ny: Tidzayamba pulogalamu ya umwini wa nyumba yomwe Malawi Housing Corporation idzakulitsidwanso kuti imange nyumba zamapangidwe osiyanasiyana kuti zigwirizane ndi zomwe mungakwanitse. Mukhala mukulipira ndalama zobwereketsa pamwezi koma zomwe zikupita kukagula nyumbayo. Tipanga umwini wanyumba kukhala wosavuta kwa aliyense. Ndondomeko yoganizira bwino za nyumba idzakhazikitsidwa kumidzi.

en: My fellow Malawians, our approach to improving living standards focuses on containing cost of living on one hand and improving incomes on the other hand while investing in physical and human capital development to put a solid foundation for economic development. That is what your next government will do.
ny: Amalawi anzanga, njira yathu yopititsira patsogolo moyo wa anthu ikuyang'ana kwambiri kukhala ndi mtengo wamoyo ndi kukweza ndalama kumbali ina kwinaku tikuika ndalama zoyendetsera chuma ndi chitukuko cha anthu kuti tikhazikitse maziko olimba a chitukuko cha chuma. Izi ndi zomwe boma lanu lotsatira lidzachite.

en: Public debt management will be key in getting the economy back on right track. Our resolve to decisively end corruption will free up resources and reduce the need for borrowing. Estimates based on previous government financial audits showed that 30% of the national budget is unaccounted for. When the system is fixed, we will save these funds and spend on intended projects. Our resolve to reform the fiscal plan so we remove unnecessary expenditure and we grow revenue base will reduce the need for borrowing. Reform of foreign missions will free up resources. Where we will have to borrow for legitimate reasons, these questions will guide in determining the source of borrowing; 1) will the loan help grow economy (GDP)? 2) will the loan help either grow tax revenue or reduce expenditure or both? 3) will the loan help grow exports? If the answer is NO especially to 2 and 3, no external loan will be contracted. If a loan still has to be secured, it will be domestic and using a long-term development bond.
ny: Kuwongolera ngongole za anthu kudzakhala kofunika kwambiri kuti chuma chibwerere m'njira yoyenera. Kutsimikiza mtima kwathu kuthetsa ziphuphu kudzamasula chuma ndi kuchepetsa kufunika kobwereka. Ziwerengero zochokera ku kafukufuku wa zachuma m’boma za m’mbuyomu zidawonetsa kuti 30% ya ndalama za dziko lino sizikudziwika. Dongosolo likakhazikitsidwa, tidzasunga ndalamazi ndikuzigwiritsa ntchito zomwe tikufuna. Kutsimikiza kwathu kusintha ndondomeko ya zachuma kuti tichotse ndalama zosafunikira komanso kukulitsa ndalama zomwe zingachepetse kufunika kobwereka. Kusintha kwa mautumiki akunja kudzamasula zothandizira. Kumene tidzayenera kubwereka pazifukwa zomveka, mafunsowa adzatsogolera pozindikira gwero la kubwereka; 1) Kodi ngongoleyo ithandiza kukulitsa chuma (GDP)? 2) Kodi ngongoleyo ithandizira kukulitsa ndalama zamisonkho kapena kuchepetsa ndalama zomwe zimagwiritsidwa ntchito kapena zonse ziwiri? 3) Kodi ngongoleyo imathandizira kukulitsa zogulitsa kunja? Ngati yankho liri AYI makamaka pa 2 ndi 3, palibe ngongole yakunja yomwe ingapangidwe. Ngati ngongole iyenera kutetezedwa, idzakhala yapakhomo komanso yogwiritsira ntchito chitukuko chanthawi yayitali.

en: Reducing debt will feed into stimulating private sector development as commercial banks and other lenders will have enough liquidity to lend to private sector at competitive interest rates. Your next government will commit to clearing payment arrears as one way of capacitating private sector to operate fully, expand production and create additional jobs.
ny: Kuchepetsa ngongole kudzakhala kulimbikitsa chitukuko cha mabungwe abizinesi chifukwa mabanki azamalonda ndi obwereketsa ena adzakhala ndi ndalama zokwanira kubwereketsa mabungwe wamba pamitengo yopikisana. Boma lanu lotsatira lidzadzipereka kubweza ngongole zomwe zabweza ngati njira imodzi yothandizira mabungwe azibizinesi kuti azigwira ntchito mokwanira, kukulitsa kupanga ndikupanga ntchito zina.

en: Corruption
ny: Ziphuphu

en: Corruption is a developmental challenge. It is a political campaign issue. Every leader promises to end corruption during political campaign yet corruption continues to worsen. Recent revelations of corruption are evident that our leaders are not only failing to end corruption, they are in fact participating in it.
ny: Ziphuphu ndizovuta zachitukuko. Ndi nkhani ya ndale. Mtsogoleri aliyense amalonjeza kuthetsa ziphuphu panthawi ya ndale koma ziphuphu zikupitirirabe. Ziphuphu zomwe zavumbulutsidwa posachedwa zikuwonekeratu kuti atsogoleri athu sakungolephera kuthetsa ziphuphu, akutenga nawo mbali.

en: A large part of our poverty is due to corruption. We have had leaders who amass wealth for themselves through corruption and morally questionable entitlements and give us leftovers. Citizens have systematically been economically disempowered so we can depend on them. They use the same corruptly acquired wealth, stolen from the many taxes we pay, to coax us to side with them when they are caught on the wrong side of the law. They project a picture that any criminal investigation in their dealings is the work of their political rivals. We fight on their behalf even when they were the first to kill us through denying us access to education, healthcare, food and job and business opportunities.
ny: Gawo lalikulu la umphawi wathu ndi chifukwa cha ziphuphu. Takhala ndi atsogoleri omwe amadziunjikira chuma chifukwa cha katangale ndi ziyeneretso zokayikitsa zamakhalidwe ndikutipatsa zotsalira. Nzika zalephera mwadongosolo pazachuma kotero titha kudalira iwo. Amagwiritsa ntchito chuma chomwe adachipeza mwachinyengo, chomwe chabedwa pamisonkho yambiri yomwe timalipira, kutikopa kuti tigwirizane nawo pamene agwidwa panjira yolakwika ya lamulo. Amapereka chithunzi chakuti kufufuza kulikonse kwaupandu muzochita zawo ndi ntchito ya otsutsana nawo andale. Timawamenyera nkhondo ngakhale pamene anali oyamba kutipha potiletsa mwayi wopeza maphunziro, chithandizo chamankhwala, chakudya, ntchito ndi bizinesi.

en: Malawi has enough financial resources to deliver public services adequately. Publicly available information confirm that it is possible to run a government without heavy borrowing. For example, it is alleged that in one contract, a business person charged government US$10,524,000 for goods that cost the business person US$2,165,700 making abnormal profit of US$8,358,300. Surely this is over- pricing and stealing from poor Malawians.
ny: Dziko la Malawi lili ndi ndalama zokwanira zoperekera ntchito za boma moyenera. Zomwe zilipo poyera zimatsimikizira kuti n'zotheka kuyendetsa boma popanda kubwereka kwambiri. Mwachitsanzo, akuti m’kontrakitala ina, munthu wina wabizinesi analipira boma ndalama zokwana madola 10,524,000 pa katundu amene wachita bizineziyo amapeza ndalama zokwana madola 2,165,700 akupanga phindu losazolowereka la US$8,358,300. Zoonadi uku ndikokwera mtengo komanso kubera Amalawi osauka.

en:
Fellow Malawians, we all can see that the main problem in Malawi is not inadequate resources but corruption and excessive and expensive entitlements of senior public officers. Fighting corruption must be a top priority for a government. That is not the case unfortunately. Some of the reasons corruption is not ending include the expensive type of political campaign and the parasitic political party system. Statistics confirm that Malawi is a least developed country hence it is a country whose people are poor and by extension, a country whose politicians are poor. The type of political campaign that is practiced is expensive and breeds a fertile ground for advance State capture by those who bankroll the campaign. Corrupt business
people finance greedy politicians in anticipation of easy access to business contracts once the politician or political party is in power. This is what has sustained State capture.
ny: Amalawi anzanga, tonse tikutha kuona kuti vuto lalikulu m’Malawi muno si kusowa kwa chuma koma katangale ndi kukwera mtengo kwa udindo wa akuluakulu aboma. Kuthana ndi ziphuphu kuyenera kukhala chinthu chofunikira kwambiri m'boma. Izi sizili choncho mwatsoka. Zina mwa zifukwa zomwe katangale sizikutha ndi monga kukwera mtengo kwa ndale ndi ndondomeko ya zipani zandale. Ziwerengero zikutsimikizira kuti dziko la Malawi ndi dziko losatukuka kwambiri choncho ndi dziko lomwe anthu ake ndi osauka komanso kuti ndi dziko lomwe andale ndi osauka. Mtundu wa kampeni ya ndale yomwe ikuchitika ndi yokwera mtengo ndipo imabweretsa mwayi woti boma lilandidwe pasadakhale ndi omwe akubweza kampeniyo. Amalonda achinyengo amapereka ndalama kwa andale adyera poyembekezera kuti adzapeza mosavuta mapangano abizinesi andale kapena chipani cha ndale chikayamba kulamulira. Izi ndi zomwe zapangitsa kuti State Capture ipitirire.

en: In State capture, the loser is the citizenry. Politicians influence award of government contracts to corrupt business people at inflated prices. The inflated prices are because the corrupt business people want to i) recover the money they spent to bankroll campaign, ii) sell the goods and services at a profit and iii) give part of the payment to the politicians so they remain connected. When the politicians get part of the payment they use part of the money for their personal projects and part of it for campaign materials and other political expenses. That is why the fight against corruption cannot be won if we continue using the same political campaign model. In fact, there are politicians who have established businesses out of money acquired in this way. Their businesses get contracts from the same government they stole capital from. In other words, our tax money has become business capital for greedy politicians and the businesses get contracts from government where they are paid by our tax money again. This is the height of impunity in Malawi. We all have a responsibility to stop this.
ny: Polanda boma, wolephera ndi nzika. Andale amasonkhezera kupereka makontrakitala aboma kwa anthu abizinesi pamitengo yokwera kwambiri. Mitengo yakwera chifukwa anthu abizinesi achinyengo akufuna i) kubweza ndalama zomwe adagwiritsa ntchito pochita kampeni yobwereketsa ndalama, ii) kugulitsa katundu ndi ntchito pakupeza phindu komanso iii) kupereka gawo la ndalamazo kwa andale kuti azilumikizana. Andale akapeza gawo la ndalamazo amagwiritsira ntchito gawo lina la ndalamazo pa ntchito zawo zaumwini ndipo mbali ina yake amagwiritsira ntchito zipangizo za kampeni ndi ndalama zina za ndale. Ndicho chifukwa chake nkhondo yolimbana ndi katangale sitingapambane ngati tipitiriza kugwiritsa ntchito ndale zomwezo. Kunena zoona, pali andale amene akhazikitsa mabizinesi chifukwa cha ndalama zopezedwa motere. Mabizinesi awo amapeza makontrakitala ku boma lomwe adaberako ndalama. M'mawu ena, ndalama zathu zamisonkho zakhala ndalama zabizinesi kwa andale adyera ndipo mabizinesi amapeza makontrakitala ku boma komwe amalipidwanso ndi ndalama zathu zamisonkho. Uku ndiye kukwera kwakusalanga m'Malawi. Tonse tili ndi udindo woletsa izi.

en: My fellow Malawians, let me illustrate how corruption causes poverty. Suppose there was money enough to construct three school blocks but due to corruption the price is inflated and the money can only construct two school blocks. Suppose each school block has two classrooms that can accommodate 60 learners. Further, suppose constructing a school block offers job opportunity to ten people as bricklayers, carpenters and others. By constructing two instead of three school blocks because of inflated prices, the results are as follows
ny: Amalawi anzanga, ndiloleni ndifotokoze mmene ziphuphu zimabweretsera umphawi. Tiyerekeze kuti panali ndalama zokwanira kumanga midadada itatu ya masukulu koma chifukwa cha katangale mtengo wakwera ndipo ndalamazo zimangomanga midadada iwiri yokha. Tiyerekeze kuti mdawo uliwonse wa sukulu uli ndi makalasi awiri otha kukhala ndi ophunzira 60. Komanso, tiyerekeze kuti kumanga bwalo la sukulu kumapereka mwayi kwa anthu khumi ngati omanga njerwa, akalipentala ndi ena. Pomanga ziwiri m’malo mwa midadada itatu yasukulu chifukwa cha kukwera mitengo kwa zinthu, zotsatira zake ndi motere

en: Three blocks would have made 360 learners move from learning under a tree to a proper classroom, but due to corruption only 240 learners will be in a good classroom. The other 120 learners will continue learning under a tree yet money was available to put them in a good classroom.
ny: Midalu itatu ikadapangitsa kuti ophunzira 360 asamuke kuchoka pakuphunzira pansi pa mtengo kupita ku kalasi yoyenera, koma chifukwa cha katangale ndi ophunzira 240 okha omwe adzakhala mkalasi yabwino. Ophunzira ena 120 apitiriza kuphunzira pansi pa mtengo komabe ndalama zinalipo zowaika m’kalasi yabwino.

en: Constructing three school blocks would create employment opportunities to 30 people. By constructing two, it means 10 people who would have some work to do still have no job.
ny: Kumanga midadada itatu kusukulu kungapangitse mwayi wa ntchito kwa anthu 30. Pomanga awiri, zikutanthauza kuti anthu 10 omwe angakhale ndi ntchito yoti agwire alibe ntchito.

en: Since there is corruption, there is high likelihood that the two school blocks may be of substandard quality. They may need maintenance quicker than if construction was not marred with corruption. Additional resources are likely to be spent to rehabilitate the same school blocks when the resources would have been spent on other functions.
ny: Popeza pali katangale, pali mwayi waukulu woti midadada ya sukulu ziwirizi ingakhale yotsika mtengo. Angafunike kukonzanso mwachangu kuposa momwe ntchito yomanga sinawonongedwe ndi ziphuphu. Zida zoonjezera zitha kugwiritsidwa ntchito kukonzanso midadada ya masukulu omwewo pomwe zothandizira zikanagwiritsidwa ntchito zina.

en: If children are learning under a tree; if there are no drugs in health facilities; if there are no all-weather roads in some areas; if jobs are scarce; if we Malawians are poor; one of the main causes is corruption.
ny: Ngati ana akuphunzira pansi pa mtengo; ngati mulibe mankhwala m'zipatala; ngati m'madera ena mulibe misewu ya nyengo yonse; ngati ntchito zili zochepa; ngati ife Amalawi ndi osauka; chimodzi mwa zifukwa zazikulu ndi ziphuphu.

en: Our approach to the fight against corruption starts from the process of getting into office. We will not do the traditional political campaign you have known. We will not do because we do not want to get money from corrupt business people so that when you vote us into office we serve them instead of serving you, Malawians.
ny: Njira yathu yolimbana ndi katangale imayambira pakulowa m'maudindo. Sitidzachita ndale zachikhalidwe zomwe mukudziwa. Sitingatero chifukwa sitifuna kupeza ndalama kwa anthu amalonda achinyengo kuti mukativotera paudindo titumikire iwo m’malo motumikira inu Amalawi.

en: We will not form a political party because it is an expensive organization that contributes to temptation of political leaders to indulge in corruption and when in office, abuse public resources to fund the political party. You can relate this to some of the revelations that are coming out now of how public institutions financed activities of a political party. We do not want to tie ourselves to the yokes that have chained the others. More importantly, not forming a political party means that there will be no group of people (members of the ruling party) that feels and behaves as more important than the rest of Malawians. Between me and the public service, there will be no person or group of people to terrorize public servants on the premise that they are the ruling party members.
ny: Sitipanga chipani cha ndale chifukwa ndi gulu lokwera mtengo lomwe limathandizira kukopa atsogoleri andale kuchita katangale ndipo akakhala paudindo amawononga chuma chaboma popereka ndalama ku zipani. Mutha kufanizira izi ndi mavumbulutso omwe akubwera tsopano a momwe mabungwe aboma amapezera ndalama za chipani cha ndale. Sitikufuna kudzimanga tokha ku magoli amene anamanga ena unyolo. Chofunika koposa, kusapanga chipani cha ndale kumatanthauza kuti sipadzakhala gulu la anthu (mamembala a chipani cholamula) amene amadziona kuti ndi ofunika kwambiri kuposa Amalawi ena onse. Pakati pa ine ndi anthu ogwira ntchito m’boma, sipadzakhala munthu kapena gulu la anthu oti aziopseza ogwira ntchito m’boma potengera kuti iwowo ndi a chipani cholamula.

en: It is not an exaggeration to say that political parties have been a disuniting factor so far in Malawi as they have been catalyst for tribalism and nepotism. You may appreciate the observation that in some political parties, it does not matter how loyal and qualified a member is, if they do not come from a particular region or from a particular tribe they cannot be voted president of a party to have a chance to contest as president of a country. We must for a moment dismantle this construct and create a political system that gives hope to every Malawian everywhere that they can be anything including President of Malawi if they work hard, have qualifications and have the integrity to serve their nation. I am convinced that being a president without a political party will foster nation building.
ny: Sikokokomeza kunena kuti zipani zandale zakhala zikugawikana m’Malawi muno kaamba koti zikudzetsa tsankho komanso kukonderana. Mungayamikire kuona kuti m’zipani zina za ndale, zilibe kanthu kuti membala ndi wokhulupirika komanso woyeneretsedwa chotani, ngati sachokera kudera linalake kapena ku fuko linalake sangavoteredwe kukhala pulezidenti wa chipani china kuti akhale ndi mwayi wochitapo kanthu. kupikisana ngati purezidenti wa dziko. Tiyezetse kaye kamangidwe kameneka ndi kukhazikitsa ndale zomwe zimapereka chiyembekezo kwa Amalawi kulikonse kuti akhoza kukhala chilichonse kuphatikiza Purezidenti wa Malawi ngati atagwira ntchito molimbika, ali ndi ziyeneretso komanso kukhala ndi umphumphu kutumikira dziko lawo. Ndine wotsimikiza kuti kukhala pulezidenti wopanda chipani chandale kudzalimbikitsa kumanga dziko.

en: Additionally, as your leader, I will have all my focus on running government, rather than divide my focus between running government on one hand and running a political party on the other hand.
ny: Kuonjezera apo, monga mtsogoleri wanu, ndidzakhala ndi maganizo anga onse pa kuyendetsa boma, osati kugawa maganizo anga pakati pa kuyendetsa boma kumbali imodzi ndi kuyendetsa chipani cha ndale kumbali ina.

en: Fighting corruption is a war. Being a war, it needs troops who are loyal to their nation, troops who are well-trained and well-resourced. Above all, troops who are best commanded. The agencies responsible for fighting corruption are the troops. The President is the commander. Like in a military war, if troops are compromised, it is difficult to win the fight against corruption. If the commander is compromised, it is impossible to win the fight against corruption.
ny: Kulimbana ndi ziphuphu ndi nkhondo. Pokhala nkhondo, pamafunika asilikali omwe ali okhulupirika ku dziko lawo, asilikali ophunzitsidwa bwino komanso ophunzitsidwa bwino. Koposa zonse, asilikali amene ali olamulidwa bwino. Mabungwe omwe ali ndi udindo wothana ndi ziphuphu ndi asitikali. Purezidenti ndiye mtsogoleri. Mofanana ndi nkhondo yankhondo, ngati asilikali asokonezedwa, n’zovuta kupambana pankhondo yolimbana ndi ziphuphu. Ngati mkulu wa asilikaliyo wanyengerera, n’zosatheka kupambana pankhondo yolimbana ndi ziphuphu.

en: For the reason that we will not get into office through a corrupt process, you can be assured that my team and I will fight against corruption decisively for we will not be haunted by our own involvement in the same. I will take it my prime responsibility that the fight against corruption is ably commanded and that if there are elements of compromised loyalty in the troops, I take corrective measures. I can guarantee that under my stewardship, no effort will be spared to fight corruption.
ny: Pachifukwa choti sitidzalowa m'maudindo chifukwa cha katangale, mutha kukhala otsimikiza kuti gulu langa ndi ine tidzalimbana ndi katangale mosamalitsa chifukwa sitidzavutitsidwa ndi kutenga nawo gawo pakuchita zomwezo. Ndidzaona kuti ndi udindo wanga waukulu kuti ntchito yolimbana ndi katangale ilamulidwe moyenera komanso kuti ngati pali zinthu zina zomwe zingasokoneze kukhulupirika m'gulu lankhondo, ndiyenera kukonza. Nditha kutsimikizira kuti pansi pa utsogoleri wanga, palibe chochita chilichonse cholimbana ndi ziphuphu.

en: The future of Malawi leadership
ny: Tsogolo la utsogoleri wa Malawi

en: Fellow Malawians, I understand the frustration among well-meaning Malawians. I am aware that some of you have lost interest in voting in next election because we have been disappointed by the political administrations we have had. I come to give hope. I come to restore the courage we always have had, believing that as citizens, power is in our hands to make a leadership that has i) integrity, ii) technical and administrative competence and iii) desire to serve.
ny: Amalawi anzanga, ndikumvetsa kukhumudwa komwe kulipo pakati pa Amalawi omwe ali ndi zolinga zabwino. Ndikudziwa kuti ena mwa inu mwataya chidwi chofuna kuvota pachisankho chikubwerachi chifukwa takhumudwitsidwa ndi maulamuliro a ndale omwe takhala nawo. Ndabwera kudzapatsa chiyembekezo. Ndabwera kudzabwezeretsa kulimba mtima komwe takhala nako, tikukhulupirira kuti monga nzika, mphamvu zili m'manja mwathu kupanga utsogoleri womwe uli ndi i) kukhulupirika, ii) luso laukadaulo ndi utsogoleri komanso iii) chikhumbo chofuna kutumikira.

en: The 2025 presidential election will be a ‘referendum’ - a choice between maintaining impunity versus ending impunity; a choice between maintaining mediocrity versus a launch of meritocracy; a choice between politicians versus leaders.
ny: Chisankho cha pulezidenti cha 2025 chidzakhala 'referendum' - kusankha pakati pa kusunga zisankho ndi kuthetsa kusalangidwa; kusankha pakati pa kukhala pakati ndi kukhazikitsidwa kwa meritocracy; kusankha pakati pa andale ndi atsogoleri.

en: To echo the words of Barack Obama, former President of the USA, “we did not inherit the country from our ancestors so we can feel a sense of entitlement, rather we borrowed it from our children and the generations to come and therefore we have an obligation to hand over a better country to them”.
ny: Kubwereza mawu a Barack Obama, Purezidenti wakale wa USA, "ife sitinatenge dziko kuchokera kwa makolo athu kotero kuti titha kumva kuti tili ndi ufulu, m'malo mwake tidabwereka kwa ana athu ndi mibadwo yomwe ikubwera ndipo chifukwa chake tili ndi ufulu. udindo wopereka dziko labwino kwa iwo.”

en: We have a responsibility to change the narrative that politics is for the few rich Malawians more so those getting rich through corruption and theft of public resources. We have a duty to change the narrative that politics is for crooks, liars, the incompetent and that politics is risky.
ny: Tili ndi udindo wosintha nkhani yoti ndale ndi za Amalawi olemera ochepa kwambiri kuposa omwe amalemera ndi katangale ndi kuba chuma chaboma. Tili ndi udindo wosintha nkhani yoti ndale ndi za achinyengo, abodza, osachita bwino komanso kuti ndale ndi zowopsa.

en: My colleagues and I are at your service and are determined to make personal sacrifices for the sake of presenting a real choice to you in the next elections. We come so that as voters you are not faced with a choice between lemons and grapefruits (manyumwa), for both are sour. We come to be your real choice. We know the contenders are heavily armoured with resources, including those they stole from our taxes.
ny: Anzanga ndi ine tiri pa ntchito yanu ndipo tatsimikiza mtima kudzimana kuti tipereke chisankho chenicheni kwa inu pamasankho otsatirawa. Tabwera kuti ngati ovota musakumane ndi chisankho pakati pa mandimu ndi manyumwa (manyumwa), pakuti zonse ndi zowawasa. Tabwera kukhala chisankho chanu chenicheni. Tikudziwa kuti opikisanawo ali ndi zida zambiri, kuphatikiza zomwe adaba misonkho yathu.

en: We are armoured with faith. We believe we shall succeed with your support. We are ready to govern and to do so competently. I have the right training, experience and exposure to public policy to competently develop the economy and run the public service. As you may appreciate, the duty of any government is two-fold; i) to develop the economy with the aim of improving people’s living standards and ii) to manage the public service so it can deliver public goods and services to people professionally, efficiently and effectively. I promise to deliver on these two cardinal roles in an excellent manner.
ny: Ndife zida zankhondo ndi chikhulupiriro. Tikukhulupirira kuti tidzapambana ndi thandizo lanu. Ndife okonzeka kulamulira ndi kuchita zimenezi mwaluso. Ndili ndi maphunziro oyenera, chidziwitso komanso kuwonetseredwa kwa ndondomeko za boma kuti ndikwaniritse bwino chuma ndikuyendetsa ntchito za boma. Monga mungazindikire, ntchito ya boma lililonse ili pawiri; i) kutukula chuma ndi cholinga chokweza moyo wa anthu ndi ii) kuwongolera ntchito za boma kuti athe kupereka katundu ndi ntchito za boma kwa anthu mwaukadaulo, mogwira mtima komanso mogwira mtima. Ndikulonjeza kuti ndidzakwaniritsa maudindo awiriwa m'njira yabwino kwambiri.

en: I appeal to you Malawians to support my candidacy. I am ready to serve you. In a special way, I encourage the youth to take 2025 election as uniquely important for I, one of their own, will be on the ballot paper. I am going to run the government in ways that will prove that the youth in Malawi are ready for the task. I will take it my additional responsibility to bring public confidence in the youth and in doing so clear a way for all youth who seek elected positions. I promise a government that will be at your service. I promise an administration that will be the moral campass of the nation.
ny: Ndikupemphani inu a Malawi kuti mundithandize pa chisankho changa. Ndine wokonzeka kukutumikirani. Mwapadera, ndikulimbikitsa achinyamata kuti atenge chisankho cha 2025 kukhala chofunikira kwambiri kwa ine, mmodzi wa iwo omwe, ndidzakhala pa pepala lovota. Ndiyendetsa boma m’njira zosonyeza kuti achinyamata a m’Malawi ndi okonzeka kugwira ntchitoyi. Nditenga udindo wanga wowonjezera kubweretsa chikhulupiliro cha anthu kwa achinyamata ndikuchita izi njira zowonekera kwa achinyamata onse omwe akufunafuna maudindo. Ndikulonjeza boma lomwe lidzakhala pa ntchito yanu. Ndikulonjeza utsogoleri womwe udzakhala gulu la makhalidwe abwino la dziko.

en: Let us together make 2025 election a turning point for Malawi. Let us together uproot the breed of corrupt, incompetent and nepotistic politicians and plant a new breed of leaders that will be a symbol of integrity, competence and service. As late Lee Kuan Yew, founding Prime Minister of Singapore said, “we need the best and ablest in politics, not charlatans with a gift of the gab”. Let us together sanitize politics in Malawi. Politics will become clean when clean people replace the dirty ones who have made it dirty.
ny: Tiyeni tonse tipange chisankho cha 2025 kukhala chosinthira ku Malawi. Tiyeni tonse pamodzi tizule mtundu wa andale achinyengo, osachita bwino komanso okondana ndikubzala mtundu watsopano wa atsogoleri omwe adzakhala chizindikiro cha umphumphu, luso ndi ntchito. Malemu a Lee Kuan Yew, Prime Minister woyambitsa wa Singapore adati, "tikufuna zabwino kwambiri komanso zamphamvu pazandale, osati achinyengo omwe ali ndi mphatso ya gab". Tiyeni tonse tiyeretse ndale ku Malawi. Ndale zidzakhala zoyera pamene anthu aukhondo alowa m’malo mwa odetsedwa amene adaipitsa.

en: I am appealing to every Malawian to engage our conscience and think of a Malawi we would want our children and grandchildren to live in. It does not matter what our current position is, what matters is the responsibility we have to ensure we hand over a better country to our children and grandchildren. You may be a serving member of the cabinet, an advisor, a senior public officer, a political party member who genuinely believes things are not the way you would have wanted to serve the nation. I ask you to support my candidacy. Tell your family and relatives to vote for me in 2025 presidential election.
ny: Ndikupempha Amalawi aliyense kuti achitepo kanthu pa chikumbumtima chathu ndipo aganizire dziko la Malawi lomwe tingafune kuti ana athu ndi zidzukulu zathu azikhalamo. Zilibe kanthu kuti tili ndi udindo wotani, chofunika ndi udindo umene tili nawo woonetsetsa kuti tapereka dziko labwino. dziko kwa ana athu ndi zidzukulu zathu. Mutha kukhala membala wa nduna, mlangizi, mkulu wa boma, membala wa chipani cha ndale amene amakhulupirira moona mtima kuti zinthu sizili momwe inu mukanafunira kutumikira dziko. Ndikukupemphani kuti mundithandizire pa chisankho changa. Uzani abale anu ndi abale anu kuti andivotere pachisankho chapulezidenti cha 2025.

en: I request you all who are in support of my candidacy to convince others around you. Convince your family members, your village mates, your village head leaders.Tell them the candidate of choice in 2025 presidential election has been identified and he is Milward Tobias. That will be your greatest contribution to my campaign.
ny: Ndikukupemphani nonse amene mukundichirikiza kuti mutsimikizire ena ozungulira inu. Atsimikizireni achibale anu, anzanu akumudzi kwanu, atsogoleri ammudzi mwanu. Auzeni kuti munthu amene angamusankhe pa chisankho cha pulezidenti wa 2025 wadziwika ndipo ndi Milward Tobias. Kumeneko kudzakhala chothandizira chanu chachikulu pa kampeni yanga.

en: To my colleagues; the road will be tough but we are ready for it and we will succeed. We will succeed because we are carrying the hopes of many Malawians who have been yearning for a leadership that can serve them, not one that serves a small group and corrupt business people. Malawians are looking for a leadership that has the integrity to tell the truth, to be accountable and transparent and to develop Malawi. It is high time Malawians became proud again of being Malawian.
ny: Kwa anzanga; msewu udzakhala wovuta koma takonzeka ndipo tidzapambana.
